Informed Consent Form: Head of Household Survey

Good morning/afternoon. My name is ____________________________ and I work for the Desmond Tutu Health Foundation (DTHF). I would like to invite you to take part in a study we are doing in collaboration with the Eastern Cape Department of Health. The focus of this study is on tuberculosis (TB), which is a very serious problem in South Africa and the Eastern Cape.

Our study aims to identify and understand how community knowledge, beliefs and social norms influence health behaviours associated with TB in your community. Your home was one of fifty (50) households in your community randomly selected to participate in our study. Your participation, and that of the other selected households, will help us understand how communities can work together to improve the health of people with TB and decrease the burden of TB in the community and throughout South Africa.

This consent form contains details about the study and what will be expected of you if you agree to participate. Before you agree to take part in the study, you should fully understand why this study is being done. I will go through this consent form with you, and make sure that you understand what the study is all about. If there is anything that you do not understand, please ask me to stop and I will explain it to you. If you have any other questions related to this study, please feel free to ask me.

PURPOSE OF THE STUDY

We are conducting the survey for two main reasons:

1. To identify and understand how community knowledge, beliefs and social norms health behaviours associated with TB in your community, and

2. To inform possible ways to improve TB and TB/HIV health outcomes among those with TB or TB/HIV

STUDY PROCEDURES

If you agree to participate, you will first be asked to sign this consent form or make your thumb print mark to show that you are willing to take part in the study. After you agree to be part of our study, you will complete a survey on a tablet computer. This should take approximately 60 minutes to complete. Before you begin the questionnaire, we will show you how to read and navigate to questions on the tablet and answer them.

The survey will ask questions about your age and your health, your level of education and your employment status, your knowledge and beliefs about TB and HIV, your home environment and community, and things that make it easy or difficult for people in your community to access care.

CONFIDENTIALITY

Your participation in this study will be kept confidential. We will not tell anyone about your participation, and we will make every effort to protect your privacy, confidentiality, answers, and information. Your information and answers will be stored either on a secure, password protected computer, or in a cabinet that will be kept locked at all times in our study office. We will identify you using a special number that will be assigned to you by a computer. Only authorised research staff will know what your special number is or be able to see your information. After these five years, any personal identifying information you provide will be destroyed.

RISKS, BENEFITS, AND COSTS TO YOU

Although you will not directly benefit from participating in this survey, your answers will provide valuable insights about TB-related beliefs and social norms in your community. By adding your insights and responses to those of TB patients and health care workers, we will be able to develop programmes to better support people seeking or undergoing TB testing, care, and treatment. Participation in this study will involve no cost to you, and you will not be paid to participate in this study.

There may be questions that make you feel uncomfortable or raise unpleasant memories. You do not need to answer these questions. If you want any further information or support related to this study, please ask me and I will do my best to answer your questions or refer you to someone who can support you.

WITHDRAWAL FROM THE STUDY

Participation in this survey is voluntary, you do not need to participate if you do not want to. You are free to skip any questions you do not want to answer. You can also choose to stop the questionnaire and withdraw your participation at any time. You can still go to the clinic for testing or services regardless of if you participate.

PROBLEMS OR QUESTIONS

If you ever have any questions or experience harm because of the study, please contact the Study Investigator Dr. Andrew Medina-Marino at 012 816 9000 or Andrew.Marino@hiv-research.org.za. This research has been approved by the University of Cape Town Human Research Ethics Committee (an independent committee established to help protect the rights of research participants). If you have any concerns about the way the study is being carried out, you may contact the committee chair, Dr. Marc Blockman, on 021 650 4015 or marc.blockman@uct.ac.za.

Molo. Igama lam ndingu ____________________________________ ndisebenzela i-Desmond Tutu Health Foundation (DTHF). Sinqwenela ukukumema ukuba uthathe inxaxheba kwisifundo esisenzayo ngokubambisana neSebe lezeMpilo laseMpuma Koloni. Esisi fundo sigxile kwisifo sephepha (i-TB), esiyingxaki enkulu kakhulu eMzantsi Afrika naseMpuma Koloni.

Esi sifundo sethu sijonge ukuchonga nokuqonda indlela ulwazi lwabahlali, iinkolelo kunye nendlela zabo zokuphila ukuba zinxulumene njani nesifo sephepha (TB) kwindawo ohlala kuyo. Ikhaya lakho lelinye lamakhaya angamashumi amahlanu (50) kwindawo ohlala kuyo elikhethwe ngokungena mkhethe ukuba lithathe inxaxheba kwisifundo sethu. Ukuthatha inxaxheba kwakho, kunye namanye amakhaya akhethiweyo, kuya kusinceda siqonde ukuba uluntu lungasebenzisana njani ukuphucula impilo yabantu abanesifo sephepha (i-TB) kunye nokunciphisa umthwalo wesifo sephepha (i-TB) kuluntu nakuMzantsi Afrika uphela.

Le fomu yemvume iqulathe iinkcukacha malunga nesifundo kwaye noko kuya kulindeleka kuwe ukuba uyavuma ukuthatha inxaxheba. Phambi kokuba uvume ukuthatha inxaxheba kwesi sifundo, kufuneka uqonde ngokupheleleyo ukuba kutheni esi sifundo sisenziwa. Ndiza kufunda le fomu yemvume kunye nawe, kwaye ndiqinisekise ukuba uyaqonda ukuba esi sifundo singantoni na. Ukuba kukho into ongayiqondiyo, ndicele ndiyeke ukufunda ndikucacisele. Ukuba unayo nayiphi na eminye imibuzo enxulumene nesi sifundo, nceda uzive ukhululekile ukundibuza.

INJONGO YESIFUNDO

Siqhuba esi sifundo ngezi zizathu zimbini ziphambili:

1. Ukuchonga nokuqonda indlela ulwazi lo luntu, inkolelo kunye nemilinganiselo yentlalo yokuziphatha kwezempilo olunxulumene nesifo sephepha (i-TB) kwindawo ohlala kuyo, kwaye

2. Ukwazisa ezinye iindlela zokuphucula iziphumo zempilo ze-TB kunye ne-TB/HIV kwabo bane-TB okanye i-TB/HIV.

IINKQUBO ZESIFUNDO

Ukuba uyavuma ukuthatha inxaxheba, uyakucelwa kuqala ukuba usayine le fomu yemvume okanye wenze uphawu lokuprinta ubhontsi wakho ukubonisa ukuba uzimisele ukuthatha inxaxheba kolu phando. Emva kokuba uvumile ukuba yinxalenye yolu phando lwethu, uya kuphendula imibuzo yophando kwithabulethi. Ukugqiba ukuphendula le mibuzo kungathatha imizuzu engama shumi amathandathu -60. Phambi kokuba uqalise uluhlu lwemibuzo, siya kukubonisa indlela yokucofa nokufunda imibuzo kwitabhulethi kwaye uyiphendule.

Uphando luza kubuza imibuzo malunga neminyaka yakho kunye nempilo yakho, inqanaba lakho lemfundo kunye nesimo sakho sengqesho, ulwazi lwakho kunye neenkolelo zakho malunga ne-TB ne-HIV, indawo yekhaya lakho kunye noluntu, kunye nezinto ezenza kube lula okanye kube nzima kubantu kwindawo ohlala kuyo ukufikelela kukhathalelo.

UKUGCINWA KWEMFIHLO

Ukuthatha kwakho inxaxheba kolu phando kuya kugcinwa kuyimfihlo. Asiyi kuxelela mntu malunga nenxaxheba yakho, kwaye siza kwenza konke okusemandleni ukukhusela imfihlo yakho, iimpendulo kunye nolwazi. Ulwazi lwakho kunye neempendulo ziya kugcinwa kwindawo ekhuselekileyo, kwikhompyutha ekhuselwe ngephasiwedi, okanye kwikhabhathi eza kugcinwa itshixiwe ngalo lonke ixesha kwiofisi yethu yophando. Siza kukuchonga sisebenzisa inombolo ekhethekileyo oya kunikwa yona yikhompyuter. Ngabasebenzi bophando abagunyazisiweyo kuphela abaya kukwazi ukuba yeyiphi inombolo yakho ekhethekileyo okanye bakwazi ukubona inkcukacha zakho. Emva kwale minyaka mihlanu, naziphi na iinkcukacha zakho ozinikezelayo ziya kutshatyalaliswa.

IINGOZI, IZIBONELELO, NEENDLEKO KUWE

Nangona ungazukuxhamla ngqo ekuthatheni inxaxheba kolu phando, iimpendulo zako ziyakunika ulwazi olu xabisekileyo ngeenkolelo nezithethe zasekuhlaleni ezinxulumene ne-TB kwindawo ohlala kuyo. Ngokongeza iimbono kunye nempendulo zakho kwezo zezigulana ze-TB nezabasebenzi bezempilo, sizokwazi ukwenza inkqubo zokuxhasa ngcono abantu abafuna okanye abavavanyelwa i-TB, ukhathalelo nonyango. Ukuthatha inxaxheba kolu phando akuyi kubandakanya ndleko kuwe, kwaye awuyi kuhlawulwa ngokuthatha inxaxheba kolu phando.

Ingakhona imibuzo enokwenza uzive ungakhululekanga okanye ivuselele iinkumbulo ezingemnandanga. Awudingi kuyiphendula lo mibuzo. Ukuba ufuna naluphi na ulwazi olongezelelweyo okanye inkxaso enxulumene nolupando, ndicela undibuze kwaye ndizakwenza konke okusemandleni am ukuphendula imibuzo yakho okanye ndikuthumele kumntu onokuxhasa.

UKURHOXA KUPHONONONGO

Ukuthatha inxaxheba koludliwano-ndlebe kungokuzithandela, awudingi ukuthatha inxaxheba ukuba awufuni. Ukhululekile ukuba utsibe nayiphi na imibuzo ongafuni ukuyiphendula. Usenokukhetha ukuyeka uphendula le mibuzo kwaye uyirhoxise inxaxheba yakho nangaliphi na ixesha. Usenako ukuya eklinikhi uyokwenza uvavanyo okanye iinkonzo nokuba awuthathi inxaxheba.
